dialogue: Of course!
What? What are you staring at? Oh-- do I have something in my teeth?
But... you're... green.
I am?
Is that so?
Yes, and it's my intention to major in sorcery, so-- if at some future time you wanted to-- address the problem? Perhaps I could-- help.
Offering to help someone you don't know with a skill you don't have. I'm sure everyone's duly impressed.
I could care less what other people think.
Couldn't.
What?
You "couldn't" care less what other people think. Though I doubt that's true.
What?!
But, Madame Morrible--
I do not, as I was promised a private suite. But thanks for asking!
I'm just shutting the door!
Oh, do you mind leaving it open? I so enjoy... air!
I saved you some space, by the way.
It was nothing. Roommates do these things for each other.
For instance, and this is just an example, I could lend you some clothes, til your luggage arrives. Since you've-- nothing to wear.
I'll have nothing to wear even after my luggage arrives.
And in return, perhaps you could-- let's see-- put in a good word for me? With Madame Morrible? Deal?
That was you. Down there. Who made all that happen.
You heard Madame Morrible.
How did you do it? Tell me. Please? I can keep a secret. Fine. Be that way. But it's a bit selfish on your part, I asked really nicely, plus, I saved you a drawer--
I don't know! I'VE NEVER KNOWN!
Dearest darlingest Momsie and Popsical...
"My dear Father... Thank you for agreeing to let me stay."
"Guess what?"
"In regards t o your request that I move in with Nessa--"
"I can't hear your guesses because this is a letter."
"I know she wouldn't want me to--" "I know how much she wants to be--"
"So I'll just tell you."
Boo.
Maybe the pronuncifi-cation of your precious name is not the sole focus of Doctor Dillamond's life. Maybe he's not like every other Professor, maybe some of us are different!
It seems the artichoke is steamed.
And this is the-- book place!
And there he is, with Galinda of course. They deserve each other.
There's a collection of rare books, somewhere... and I guess some medium-rare books too...
Fiyero is checking out the female students...
Galinda-- Nessa and I were talking. About you, and--
And we were just talking about you! How you should join us tonight!
I don't follow.
You. Join. Us. A t the Ozdust. I'm inviting you!
Why.
Because everyone will be there. And don't tell me you've nothing to wear, you could wear-- let's see--
She looks around, then-- holds the black hat out to Elphaba.
--this!
I mean, it goes with everything you own!
Do funerals count?
I couldn't remotely sleep.
Me neither.
I know! Let's each tell the other something we've never told an yone! I'll go first: Fiyero and I are getting married!
He asked you already?
Oh, he doesn't know yet. Now you tell me a secret.
Like what?
Like-- why do you sleep with this-- --little green bottle under your pillow?
Give that back!
Come on-- tell!
It was my mother's, that's all.
Well that's not fair, I told you a really good one.
My father hates me.
That's not the secret. The secret is. .. He has a good reason. It's my fault.
What, what is?
Green?
He was so worried, he made our mother chew milk flowers, day and night. Only it made Nessa c ome too soon... with her little legs all tangled. And our mother... never woke up.
None of which would ever have happened... if not for me.
But that was the milkflowers' fault, not yours.
That may be your secret, Elphaba. But it doesn't make it true.
Look-- it's tomorrow! And Elphie-- may I call you Elphie?
It's a little perky.
And you can call me... Galinda.
It's your name.
Let's not quarrel. Because Elphie-- now that we're friends, I've decided to make you my new project!
You really don't have to do that.
I know! That's what makes me so nice!
This won't end well.
Elphie! You mustn't think that way-- your whole life is going to change! And all because of me!
Now then. Let us begin. Hair. We toss our hair. See? Toss! Toss!
Well-- you'll practice! And now-- I shall transform your simple "frock" into a magnificent ball gown!
Oh no.
Ball gown.
Ball gown!
Ball gown! Is this on?
I can't wear things like that anyway.
Of course you can. We'll just start... smaller.
Pink goes good wit h green.
It goes well with green.
It so does.
Why, Miss Elphaba-- you're beautiful.
I-- I have to go--
You're welcome!
Unlimited?
I will--
Now, you're sure you have everything? Elphie!
I can't believe it.
I'll find him--
Nessa...
There are other boys. Who you may not have noticed. Who've noticed you.
Boq...?
Oh, Boq.
Elphie!
Where's Nessa?
She left with your father. She said to wish you safe travels. She'll be fine, Elphie. She'll have to manage without you. We all will.
Oh, you'll barely notice I'm gone. You have Fiyero! Where is he, anyway? Not that I expected him to say goodbye to me. I mean, we barely know each other.
I barely know him either, anymore! He's-- different. Distant, and moodified... and he's been thinking, which really worries me.
It all started th at day Doctor Dillamond was fired. I never knew Fiyero cared so much about that old Goat.
Oh, there he is! He did come! Fiyero! Over here, dearest!
